allow:
Bash(python3 << 'EOF'
import json

# Define 90 unique motivational quotes for the first quarter
quotes = [
    # January
    {"text": "Start today with a peaceful mind, knowing the Divine is within all.", "translation": "Begin with peace, knowing the Self resides in every creature.", "chapter": 12, "verse": 13},
    {"text": "Your right is to perform your duty only, but never to the fruits of your work.", "translation": "You have the right to perform your duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 47},
    {"text": "The wise see knowledge and action as one, for the true wise see sameness in both.", "translation": "The wise perceive knowledge and action as one and the same.", "chapter": 5, "verse": 4},
    {"text": "Work done as an offering to the Divine frees one from the bondage of karma.", "translation": "Actions performed as sacrifice liberate one from binding karma.", "chapter": 3, "verse": 9},
    {"text": "Meditation is the journey of the mind from distraction to one-pointed focus.", "translation": "Meditation is the journey of the mind to one-pointed focus.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 10},
    {"text": "Better is one's own duty though imperfectly performed than another's duty well performed.", "translation": "Better to do one's own duty imperfectly than to do another's duty perfectly.", "chapter": 3, "verse": 35},
    {"text": "Free from attachment and aversion, equiposed in success and failure, one is truly wise.", "translation": "Equipoise of mind in success and failure is called yoga.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 48},
    {"text": "The Supreme Soul dwells in every creature's heart, directing their movements.", "translation": "The Lord dwells in the hearts of all beings, causing them to move as if mounted on a machine.", "chapter": 18, "verse": 61},
    {"text": "The Self is eternal, imperishable, and immutable; it cannot be destroyed with the body.", "translation": "The Self is eternal, imperishable, and immutable; the body is temporary.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 20},
    {"text": "He who sees the Supreme Lord prevailing equally in all beings, truly sees.", "translation": "He sees who sees the Supreme Lord present equally in all beings.", "chapter": 13, "verse": 27},
    {"text": "Offer your actions to Me, be devoted to Me, and you will be liberated from karma.", "translation": "Offer all your actions to Me, be devoted to Me, and you will be freed.", "chapter": 9, "verse": 27},
    {"text": "The wise man sees the same spirit in every creature, regardless of outward form.", "translation": "The wise see the same spirit in every being, whether in a Brahmin, a cow, or even an outcaste.", "chapter": 5, "verse": 18},
    {"text": "Better to die in one's own duty than to live by the duty of another.", "translation": "One's own duty, though defective, is better than another's duty well performed.", "chapter": 3, "verse": 35},
    {"text": "The Self is beyond the gunas, beyond the material world, and is the witness of all.", "translation": "The Supreme Self is beyond the gunas, the witness, the permitting agent.", "chapter": 14, "verse": 19},
    {"text": "He who has no attachment, whose mind is steady, performs actions without desire.", "translation": "He who has no attachment, whose mind is fixed, performs actions without desire.", "chapter": 5, "verse": 8},
    {"text": "Yoga is the journey of the mind to find the Supreme Divine, the source of all peace.", "translation": "Yoga is the separation from union with sorrow.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 23},
    {"text": "When the mind is restrained and the senses are withdrawn, one attains supreme peace.", "translation": "When the mind is stilled and the senses withdrawn, the yogi attains perfection.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 18},
    {"text": "The disciplined soul, resting in the Self, sees by the wisdom of the Self all things.", "translation": "Resting in the Self, the disciplined soul sees all beings in the Self.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 20},
    {"text": "Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me, I will deliver you.", "translation": "Surrender unto Me alone with all your heart, and I shall deliver you from all sins.", "chapter": 18, "verse": 66},
    {"text": "The mind is difficult to control, but it can be restrained by practice and detachment.", "translation": "The mind is difficult to control, but it can be restrained by practice and detachment.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 35},
    {"text": "He who is equipoised in pleasure and pain, heat and cold, honor and dishonor, is established in yoga.", "translation": "He who is equipoised in pleasure and pain, heat and cold, honor and dishonor.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 38},
    {"text": "That supreme abode is attained by those who pass away without regret.", "translation": "That supreme abode is attained by those who pass away without regret.", "chapter": 8, "verse": 21},
    {"text": "He who sees the Lord Supreme abiding equally in all beings, attains the Supreme.", "translation": "He who sees the Lord Supreme abiding equally in all beings, attains the Supreme.", "chapter": 13, "verse": 28},
    {"text": "The wise perform all actions for the sake of yoga, abandoning attachment to results.", "translation": "The wise seek liberation through action, abandoning attachment to results.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 47},
    {"text": "Knowledge is better than practice, but meditation is better than knowledge, than follows action.", "translation": "Better indeed is knowledge than practice; better than knowledge is meditation.", "chapter": 12, "verse": 12},
    {"text": "The self-controlled man, dwelling in the Self, rejoice in the Self, and is satisfied.", "translation": "He who is self-controlled and satisfied in the Self alone rejoices forever.", "chapter": 5, "verse": 23},
    {"text": "Material nature consists of three gunas - sattva \(purity\), rajas \(passion\), and tamas.", "translation": "From the three gunas of nature spring all cosmic manifestations.", "chapter": 14, "verse": 6},
    {"text": "Know that which is beyond the gunas to be the eternal, immutable, and blissful Self.", "translation": "That which is beyond the three gunas is immortal, immutable, and blissful.", "chapter": 14, "verse": 20},
    {"text": "The body is called the field, and one who knows the body is called the knower of the field.", "translation": "This body is the field of activity for the soul, and the knower of the field is the wise one.", "chapter": 13, "verse": 1},
    {"text": "Whenever dharma declines and the purpose of life is forgotten, I manifest Myself.", "translation": "I manifest on earth whenever righteousness declines and the purpose of life is forgotten.", "chapter": 4, "verse": 7},
    {"text": "Those who seek freedom through renunciation are truly ascetics, not those without fire.", "translation": "True renunciation is freedom through renunciation, not living without fire or vows.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 1},
    {"text": "Arjuna, when a man dwells in the Self, seeing all beings in the Self and the Self.", "translation": "He sees who sees all beings in the Self and the Self in all beings.", "chapter": 6, "verse": 29},
    {"text": "The gunas binding the eternal soul to the body are sattva, rajas, and tamas.", "translation": "The three gunas bind the indestructible soul to the material body.", "chapter": 14, "verse": 5},
    {"text": "He who sees all beings with equal eyes, understanding their true nature, attains peace.", "translation": "The wise see equality in all beings, establishing themselves in the Divine.", "chapter": 5, "verse": 18},
    {"text": "Work done as an offering to the Divine frees one from the bondage of karma.", "translation": "Actions performed as sacrifice liberate one from binding karma.", "chapter": 3, "verse": 9},
    {"text": "The soul is never born nor does it ever die, nor is it that having once existed.", "translation": "The Self is never born nor does it ever die; it is unborn, eternal, and immutable.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 20},
    {"text": "As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul accepts new bodies.", "translation": "As a person puts on new clothes, the soul puts on new bodies, casting off the old.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 22},
    {"text": "The weapon cannot cut the Self, the fire cannot burn Him, the water cannot wet Him.", "translation": "The Self cannot be cut by weapons, burned by fire, wetted by water, or dried by wind.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 23},
    {"text": "The Self is invisible, inconceivable, and unchangeable; knowing this, you should not grieve.", "translation": "The Self is invisible, inconceivable, and immutable; knowing this, you should not mourn.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 25},

    {"text": "He who is free from attachment and aversion, who remains equipoised, is dear to Me.", "translation": "He who is free from attachment, fear, and anger is dear to Me.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 56},
    {"text": "The wise are grieving neither for the living nor for the dead; they see the eternal.", "translation": "The wise grieve neither for the living nor for the dead, for they see the eternal.", "chapter": 2, "verse": 11},

    {"text": "Arjuna said: If you consider knowledge superior to action, why then do you engage me?", "translation": "If knowledge is superior to action, why do you engage me in this dreadful action?", "chapter": 2, "verse": 55},

print\(f"Total quotes defined: {len\(quotes\)}"\)

# Create full year by cycling through quotes
year_data = {"2026": {}}

day_idx = 0
for month in range\(1, 13\):
    month_str = f"{month:02d}"
    year_data["2026"][month_str] = {}
    
    # Get days in month for 2026 \(not a leap year\)
    if month == 2:
        days_in_month = 28
    elif month in [4, 6, 9, 11]:
        days_in_month = 30
    else:
        days_in_month = 31
    
    for day in range\(1, days_in_month + 1\):
        day_str = f"{day:02d}"
        year_data["2026"][month_str][day_str] = quotes[day_idx % len\(quotes\)]
        day_idx += 1

print\(f"Total entries in full year: {sum\(len\(m\) for m in year_data['2026'].values\(\)\)}"\)

# Save to file
with open\('/mnt/d/Projects/hello-fastapi/data/daily_motivation.json', 'w'\) as f:
    json.dump\(year_data, f, indent=2\)

print\("Full year JSON saved successfully!"\)
EOF)
